intro: Humboltia longirostris, commonly known as the long-snouted hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive elongated calyx that resembles a snout, giving it its common name. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Humboltia longirostris is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks.
